Name: Alex Tsimerman
Summary: Alex Tsimerman has run unsuccessfully for multiple political positions. He regularly berates elected officials during public meetings.

Name: Ann Davison Sattler
Summary: Ann Davison Sattler is an attorney who once worked for the Seattle SuperSonics. She says the city should further subsidize recreational activities for low-income children.
Problem: Homelessness combined with an opioid epidemic
Endorsements: Nate McMillan (former Seattle SuperSonics player and head coach)

Name: Debora Juarez
Summary: Debora Juarez is the District 5 incumbent. She's overseen deals to renovate KeyArena and the downtown waterfront.
Committee: Civic Development, Public Assets, and Native Communities
Problem: Seattle, especially District 5, is growing at a rapid rate so we need to focus on homelessness, public safety and the need for more transportation options like light rail.

Name: John Lombard
Summary: John Lombard previously led the North District Council and the Thornton Creek Alliance. He says the incumbent has ignored neighborhood concerns.
Endorsements: Community leaders, including Daigoro Toyoma, President of the Pinehurst Community Council; Brad Cummings, former Co-Chair, North District Council, and former President, Victory Heights Community Council; Ruth Williams, former President, Thornton Creek Alliance; Dan Keefe, former Co-Chair, North District Council, and former President, Meadowbrook Community Council; and Don Thornton, board member, Haller Lake Community Club

Name: Mark Mendez
Summary: Mark Mendez is a community and youth organizer in Lake City, where he grew up. He's worked for theYMCA and has been involved with the Lake City Neighborhood Alliance.
Committee: Human Services, Equitable Development and Renter Rights
Problem: Affordable housing and homelessness, bringing more resources to our three underserved urban villages (Lake City, Bitter Lake and Aurora-Licton), youth as future leaders and protecting our environment

Name: Tayla Mahoney
Summary: Tayla Mahoney is an electrical administrator and a graduate of the Seattle University School of Law.
Problem: Effectively addressing the cycle of homelessness
